Arunachal pradhesh.name: Tawang
Arunachal pradhesh.description: A serene town known for its largest monastery in India and stunning mountain views.

Arunachal pradhesh.name: Ziro Valley
Arunachal pradhesh.description: A picturesque valley known for its lush greenery, unique tribal culture, and serene environment.

Arunachal pradhesh.name: Sela Pass
Arunachal pradhesh.description: A high-altitude mountain pass that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding Himalayan landscape.

Arunachal pradhesh.name: Namdapha National Park
Arunachal pradhesh.description: A vast national park known for its incredible biodiversity and pristine rainforest environment.

Arunachal pradhesh.name: Itanagar
Arunachal pradhesh.description: The capital city of Arunachal Pradesh, offering a mix of culture, history, and natural beauty.

Arunachal pradhesh.name: Bomdila
Arunachal pradhesh.description: A quaint town known for its monasteries, scenic views, and serene ambiance.

Arunachal pradhesh.name: Dirang
Arunachal pradhesh.description: A peaceful village known for its natural beauty, hot springs, and unique tribal culture.

Assam.name: Kaziranga National Park
Assam.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its population of one-horned rhinoceroses.

Assam.name: Majuli
Assam.description: The world's largest river island, known for its monasteries and natural beauty.

Assam.name: Manas National Park
Assam.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and a biosphere reserve known for its diverse wildlife.

Assam.name: Sivasagar
Assam.description: Known for its historical monuments from the Ahom dynasty.

Assam.name: Guwahati
Assam.description: The largest city in Assam, known for its temples and the mighty Brahmaputra River.

Assam.name: Kamakhya Temple
Assam.description: One of the most important Shakti Peethas, located atop Nilachal Hill.

Assam.name: Dibrugarh
Assam.description: Known as the Tea City of India, Dibrugarh offers scenic landscapes and a vibrant culture.

Bihar.name: Bodh Gaya
Bihar.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Bodh Gaya is where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree.

Bihar.name: Nalanda
Bihar.description: An ancient seat of learning, Nalanda is a UNESCO World Heritage Site with ruins of a historic university.

Bihar.name: Rajgir
Bihar.description: An ancient city with connections to Buddhism and Jainism, known for its hot springs and scenic beauty.

Bihar.name: Vaishali
Bihar.description: An ancient city significant to both Buddhism and Jainism, Vaishali is known for its archaeological and historical importance.

Bihar.name: Patna
Bihar.description: The capital city of Bihar, Patna is a vibrant mix of history, culture, and modernity.

Bihar.name: Vikramshila
Bihar.description: An ancient center of learning, known for its contribution to Buddhist education and culture.

Bihar.name: Barabar Caves
Bihar.description: The oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India, dating back to the Mauryan Empire.

Chhattisgarh.name: Chitrakote Falls
Chhattisgarh.description: Known as the 'Niagara Falls of India,' Chitrakote Falls is a stunning natural attraction on the Indravati River.

Chhattisgarh.name: Kanger Valley National Park
Chhattisgarh.description: A biodiversity hotspot, Kanger Valley National Park is known for its unique limestone caves and rich wildlife.

Chhattisgarh.name: Barnawapara Sanctuary
Chhattisgarh.description: A small yet beautiful sanctuary, Barnawapara is home to rich flora and fauna, including leopards, bisons, and peacocks.

Chhattisgarh.name: Raipur
Chhattisgarh.description: The capital city of Chhattisgarh, Raipur is a hub of culture, commerce, and historical sites.

Chhattisgarh.name: Bhoramdeo Temple
Chhattisgarh.description: Known as the 'Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh,' this 11th-century temple is famous for its exquisite carvings.

Chhattisgarh.name: Sirpur
Chhattisgarh.description: An archaeological site with a mix of Hindu and Buddhist heritage, Sirpur is a treasure trove of history.

Chhattisgarh.name: Danteshwari Temple
Chhattisgarh.description: A revered temple dedicated to Goddess Danteshwari, considered one of the 52 Shakti Peethas.

Goa.name: Calangute Beach
Goa.description: Known as the 'Queen of Beaches,' Calangute is one of Goa's most popular beach destinations.

Goa.name: Dudhsagar Falls
Goa.description: A four-tiered waterfall, Dudhsagar Falls is a mesmerizing natural wonder situated on the Mandovi River.

Goa.name: Panaji
highlights: Church of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception
Goa.description: The capital of Goa, Panaji is known for its Portuguese-style architecture, vibrant streets, and serene riverside promenades.

Goa.name: Baga Beach
Goa.description: One of the most happening beaches in Goa, Baga Beach is famous for its nightlife, water sports, and beach shacks.

Goa.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
Goa.description: A historic church in Old Goa, the Basilica of Bom Jesus is a significant landmark known for its baroque architecture.

Goa.name: Aguada Fort
highlights: Scenic Views of the Arabian Sea
Goa.description: A historic Portuguese fort, Aguada Fort is a well-preserved landmark offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea.

Goa.name: Anjuna Beach
Goa.description: Known for its serene vibes and vibrant flea market, Anjuna Beach is a favorite among tourists seeking a laid-back atmosphere.

Gujarat.name: Statue of Unity
Gujarat.description: A monumental statue of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, the Statue of Unity is a marvel of modern engineering.

Gujarat.name: Gir National Park
Gujarat.description: The only home of the Asiatic lions, Gir National Park is a sanctuary teeming with wildlife and natural beauty.

Gujarat.name: Rann of Kutch
Gujarat.description: A surreal white desert, the Rann of Kutch is a must-visit destination known for its unique landscape and vibrant festival.

Gujarat.name: Somnath
Gujarat.description: A historic pilgrimage site, Somnath is famous for its revered temple and coastal charm.

Gujarat.name: Dwarka
Gujarat.description: An ancient city, Dwarka is one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites and holds immense religious significance.

Gujarat.name: Sabarmati Ashram
Gujarat.description: A place of historic importance, Sabarmati Ashram was the residence of Mahatma Gandhi and a center for the freedom movement.
Gujarat.nearest_airport: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport, Ahmedabad

Gujarat.name: Saputara
Gujarat.description: Gujarat's only hill station, Saputara offers a serene environment, picturesque landscapes, and a cool climate.

Haryana.name: Kurukshetra
Haryana.description: Known as the land of the Mahabharata, Kurukshetra is a historic city with immense spiritual significance.

Haryana.name: Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary
Haryana.description: A haven for bird watchers, Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is home to numerous migratory and resident bird species.

Haryana.name: Pinjore Gardens
Haryana.description: A beautiful example of Mughal gardens, Pinjore Gardens is a tranquil retreat with fountains and lush greenery.

Haryana.name: Morni Hills
Haryana.description: The only hill station in Haryana, Morni Hills offers serene landscapes, perfect for a peaceful getaway.

Haryana.name: Brahma Sarovar
Haryana.description: A revered water body, Brahma Sarovar is considered one of the largest and holiest tanks in India.

Haryana.name: Surajkund
Haryana.description: Famous for its annual crafts mela, Surajkund is a vibrant hub of art, culture, and traditional crafts.

Haryana.name: Kalesar National Park
Haryana.description: A dense forest area, Kalesar National Park is a great destination for nature and wildlife enthusiasts.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Dharamshala
Himachal Pradesh.best_month: March to June, September to November
Himachal Pradesh.description: Known as the residence of the Dalai Lama, Dharamshala offers a blend of spirituality and natural beauty.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Kullu
Himachal Pradesh.best_month: March to June, September to November
Himachal Pradesh.description: Known as the 'Valley of Gods', Kullu is a picturesque valley surrounded by towering hills and deodar forests.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Dalhousie
Himachal Pradesh.best_month: March to June, October to November
Himachal Pradesh.description: Dalhousie is a charming hill station with colonial charm, lush greenery, and serene landscapes.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Spiti Valley
Himachal Pradesh.description: Known as the 'Middle Land', Spiti Valley is a cold desert with breathtaking landscapes and monasteries.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Chamba
Himachal Pradesh.best_month: March to June, September to November
Himachal Pradesh.description: A historic town, Chamba is known for its ancient temples, art, and stunning views of the Himalayas.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Shimla
Himachal Pradesh.best_month: March to June, December to February (for snow)
Himachal Pradesh.description: The capital of Himachal Pradesh, Shimla is known for its colonial architecture, scenic hills, and pleasant weather.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Manali
Himachal Pradesh.description: A popular hill station, Manali is famous for its adventure activities and picturesque landscapes.
